Pre-Game Insights: The Blue Jays and Red Sox are resuming a suspended game from June 26 with rosters that look substantially different.
Danny Jansen will become the first ever MLB player to play for two teams in the same game.
Joey Loperfido has a chance to play in two games in two different cities on the same day.

Rookies Will Wagner and Leo Jimenez will have a chance to go back in time, re-recording big-league firsts in a game that will technically take place on a date before they made their major-league debuts.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game is a result of the Blue Jays and Red Sox trying to resume a suspended game from June 26.
The game is unusual due to the different rosters of the two teams.
The game may be a bullpen game for the Blue Jays, with veteran right-hander Paolo Espino being added as pitching depth.
Others: The Blue Jays have been in touch with MLB officials, including Michael Hill, the league's senior vice president of on-field operations.
The game's unusual nature leads to lots of questions, and the Blue Jays have been in touch with MLB officials to clarify the rules.
